meaning_cn: 胆怯的，羞怯的；易受惊的
definition: showing a lack of courage or confidence; easily frightened
example: My dog is a little timid—especially around other dogs.

meaning_cn: 本土的，土生土长的；生来的，固有的
definition: originating or occurring naturally in a particular place; native
example: This plant is indigenous to southern Europe.

meaning_cn: （尤指团体或地区）有钱的，富裕的
definition: having a great deal of money; wealthy
example: We live in an affluent neighborhood.

definition: lacking sophistication or good taste; unrefined
disappear suddenly and completely
example: He vanished without trace.

definition: restore friendly relations between
example: She wanted to be reconciled with her father.

definition: powerfully attract or charm; tempt
example: I had been fool enough to allow myself to be so quickly allured by her charms.

definition: a small booklet or leaflet containing information about a single subject
to make something stronger
example: The many hours they spent working together helped to cement their relationship.

meaning_cn: 将（基于统计的方法或结论）类推（或外推）
definition: extend the application of a method or conclusion to an unknown situation
example: The results cannot be extrapolated to other patient groups.

meaning_cn: （物体边缘或表面上的）槽口，凹痕，切口
definition: an indentation or incision on an edge or surface
example: The Indians cut notches on a stick to keep count of numbers.

meaning_cn: 最后处于，最后成为，以…告终
definition: to finally be in a particular place or situation
example: She'll end up penniless if she continues to spend like that.

meaning_cn: 怪诞的，罕见的，异乎寻常的
definition: very strange or unusual
example: Many costumes are bizarre works of art ranging from toothbrushes to mattresses.

definition: demonstrate or indicate clearly
example: He had a rolling gait that proclaimed him a man of the sea.

definition: treat as unworthy of serious consideration
example: I think he'd dismissed me as an idiot within five minutes of meeting me.

meaning_cn: 拥有权力，具有影响力；挥，操，使用
definition: to have a lot of influence or power; to hold something ready to use
example: He still wields enormous influence in politics.

meaning_cn: 控制，遏制，制止（有害物蔓延）
definition: to keep something harmful within limits and not allow it to spread
example: Farms in the area have been closed off to contain the disease.

definition: to consider or have the opinion that something is as stated
example: I don't reckon much of their chances of winning.

definition: impossible to understand
example: Some of the lyrics are completely impenetrable.

meaning_cn: 猜，猜测，估计；天赐的，上帝的，神的
definition: 1. to guess something; 2. coming from or connected with God
example: I divined from his grim expression that the news was not good.

meaning_cn: 把…搬来搬去；把…移来移去
definition: to move similar things from one position to another
example: Many prisoners have to be shuffled around police stations.

definition: a feeling of great respect sometimes mixed with fear or surprise
example: You can't help but stand in awe of powerful people.

meaning_cn: 例行公事，老规矩；（尤指）仪式
definition: a set of fixed actions performed regularly, especially as part of a ceremony
example: Coffee and the newspaper are part of my morning ritual.

definition: the fact that there is too little of something
example: There is a paucity of information on the ingredients of many cosmetics.

meaning_cn: 泄露秘密的，暴露内情的，能说明问题的
definition: revealing, indicating, or betraying something
example: She found lipstick on his shirts - the telltale sign that he was having an affair.

definition: sad, gloomy, or depressed
example: The dog has a melancholy expression.

definition: If a thought or idea occurs to you, it comes into your mind
example: Does it ever occur to you that I might want to be on my own sometimes?

definition: change one's decisions, plans, or attitude, especially due to criticism
example: His proposals were clearly unreasonable and he was soon forced to retreat.

definition: cause someone to have a particular impression
example: The idea struck her as odd.

definition: feeling distressed or pessimistic
example: I am by no means gloomy about the prospects for British industry.

meaning_cn: 毫不犹豫地，毫不勉强地；乐意地，欣然地
definition: without hesitation or reluctance; willingly
example: He readily admits that the new car surpasses its predecessors.

definition: according to a person's habitual practice
example: I put the kettle on for our customary cup of coffee.

definition: surpass someone in competition
example: They were outcompeted by their foreign rivals.

definition: similar to
example: We try to keep our prices in line with our competitors.

definition: an arrangement of parts or elements in a particular form
example: The broad configuration of the economy remains capitalist.

definition: exercising a compelling charm which inspires devotion in others
example: He's so charismatic; he's got such a great sense of humor.

definition: to happen or make something happen sooner or faster
example: Inflation is likely to accelerate this year.

definition: harm or trouble caused by someone or something
example: She was bent on making mischief.

definition: the quality of working carefully and with a lot of effort
example: She hoped that her diligence would be noticed at work.

definition: to come together or bring people together in order to help or support
example: The cabinet rallied behind the Prime Minister.

meaning_cn: 先前出现的事例，前例，先例
definition: a similar action or event that happened earlier
example: There is no precedent for a disaster of this scale.

meaning_cn: （支持或为之奋斗的）事业，目标，思想
definition: an organization or idea that people support or fight for
example: Animal welfare campaigners raised 70,000 for their cause last year.

definition: too satisfied with yourself or a situation
example: We must not become complacent about progress.

definition: brave; willing to do dangerous or unusual things
example: The gallery was known for putting on daring exhibitions.
